abstract: Jurors in Colorado trial against Aurora movie theater shooter James E Holmes determine that prosecution proved argument of aggravating factors, opening possibility of death penalty; trial advances to next phase where mitigating factors such as mental illness and criminal record are considered, which could provide grounds for life imprisonment instead of execution.
lead_paragraph: The jury found that prosecutors in the Aurora movie massacre trial had proved aggravating factors, and will now consider mitigating aspects.

headline.main: Colorado: Jurors Weigh Death Penalty in Massacre
headline.print_headline: Colorado: Jurors Weigh Death Penalty in Massacre

snippet: The jury found that prosecutors in the Aurora movie massacre trial had proved aggravating factors, and will now consider mitigating aspects.
